episodes.title: The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean
episodes.description: Carl Sagan examines our planet's place in the universe by leading us on a journey from Earth to Deep Space.

episodes.title: One Voice in the Cosmic Fugue
episodes.description: Carl Sagan examines the origin, development, and complexity of life on Earth and speculates on the possibility of life developing elsewhere in the universe.

episodes.title: Harmony of the Worlds
episodes.description: After briefly looking at the pseudoscience of astrology, Carl Sagan examines the history of astronomy from ancient times through Ptolemy to Johannes Kepler.

episodes.title: Heaven and Hell
episodes.description: Carl Sagan examines the nature of comets before turning to a close look at the planet Venus.

episodes.title: Blues for a Red Planet
episodes.description: Carl Sagan looks at the search for life on Mars from the speculations of Percival Lowell and H.G. Wells to the arrival of the Viking probes.

episodes.title: Travellers' Tales
episodes.description: Carl Sagan looks at the planets Jupiter and Saturn by examining the work of Galileo, Huygens, and the Voyager probes.

episodes.title: The Backbone of Night
episodes.description: Carl Sagan looks at the work of ancient Greek scientists and astronomers including Thales, Anaximander, Democritus, and Pythagoras.

episodes.title: Journeys in Space and Time
episodes.description: Carl Sagan explains scientific concepts like relativity and examines the possibility of time travel.

episodes.title: The Lives of the Stars
episodes.description: Carl Sagan examines the life cycle of stars from their creation to their deaths.

episodes.title: S1.E10 ∙ The Edge of Forever
episodes.description: Carl Sagan focuses on the origin of the universe by discussing the Big Bang, Galaxies, Dimensions, and the expansion of the universe.

episodes.title: S1.E11 ∙ The Persistence of Memory
episodes.description: Carl Sagan examines life on earth discussing genes, DNA, the brain, and human social development.

episodes.title: S1.E12 ∙ Encyclopaedia Galactica
episodes.description: Carl Sagan examines the possibility extraterrestrial life and discusses his skepticism about UFOs.

episodes.title: S1.E13 ∙ Who Speaks for Earth?
episodes.description: Carl Sagan considers the significance of science and discuss the importance of human survival in the nuclear age.
